* Fedora requires a minimum of 20GB dis: * Fedora requires a minimum of 20GB disk, 2GB RAM, to install and run successfully. Double those amounts is recommended.
Get started by using Fedora Media Writer: Get started by using Fedora Media Writer, which makes it super easy to give Fedora a try. [Learn More](https://docs.fedoraproject.org/en-US/fedora/latest/preparing-boot-media/#_fedora_media_writer)
Getting going with Fedora is easier than:
Getting going with Fedora is easier than ever. All you need is a 2GB USB flash drive, and Fedora Media Writer.
Once Fedora Media Writer is installed, it will set up your flash drive to run a "Live" version of Fedora Workstation, meaning that you can boot it from your flash drive and try it out right away without making any permanent changes to your computer. Once you are hooked, installing it to your hard drive is a matter of clicking a few buttons*.
Learn more about Fedora Media Writer: Learn more about Fedora Media Writer

We've partnered with companies like Leno: We've partnered with companies like Lenovo to bring you laptops pre-loaded with Fedora that include fully-supported hardware components.
